items.title: Panacea Biotec shares in focus on contract from UNICEF
items.description: Panacea Biotec Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 489.00 and a 52-week low of Rs 112.70 on 12 December, 2024 and 04 June, 2024, respectively. Currently, the stock is trading 11.13 percent below its 52-week high and 285.58 percent above its 52-week low.

items.title: BPCL shares in focus on winning 150 MW solar PV power project
items.description: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Share Price | The company board at its meeting held on December 24, has accorded its approval to commence pre project activities for setting up of a green field refinery cum petrochemical complex in East Coast at Andhra Pradesh at an estimated cost of Rs 6100 crore.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty suggests a flat start; Asian markets trade higher
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates:  Asia’s benchmark stock index rose as equities gained in Japan and South Korea, while several other regional markets remain shut for holidays. Sentiment was boosted after US shares extended this year’s rally on Tuesday. Wall Street's main indexes all closed higher on Tuesday, with gains in megacap and growth stocks bolstering benchmarks in a truncated Christmas Eve session.

items.title: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade - First Tick
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a muted start for the day. Asia’s benchmark stock index rose as equities gained in Japan and South Korea, while several other regional markets remain shut for holidays. Sentiment was boosted after US shares extended this year’s rally on Tuesday.

items.title: Most Asian stocks rise amid thin holiday trading
items.description: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda gave a talk on Wednesday and avoided giving a clear signal that he might raise interest rates next month by reiterating the need to keep monitoring risks for the economy in comments that nudged down the yen.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: NALCO, BPCL, Gland Pharma, Panacea Biotec, Ramky Infra, Ceigall India, Manorama in focus on 26 December
items.description: Stocks To Watch Today, Dec 26: Stocks like Bharat Forge, EPACK Durable. UltraTech Cement, Goa Carbon, Macrotech Developers, Religare Enterprises, Aditya Birla Capital, Snowman Logistics, Kalyani Cast-Tech, and Manorama Industries will also be in focus on December 26.

items.title: Sensex rises 300 points, Nifty tops 23,800 in thin trade, banks and auto rally on expiry day
items.description: The broader market also mirrored positive trends in the morning. Both mid-cap and small cap indexes rose  0.2 percent, each.

items.title: GuruSpeak| Puneet Sharma's trading journey: Mastering quantitative trading through data and algos
items.description: His trading approach combines quantitative strategies, algorithmic models, and robust risk management protocols and prioritises maintaining a high risk-to-reward ratio to ensure long-term profitability

items.title: RR Kabel: Correction spells long-term opportunity
items.description: A strong brand recall and the shift in produce mix are positives for profitability

items.title: Agri Picks Report December 26, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Farmers in Maharashtra have sown rabi crops over 5.5 million hectares as of Tuesday, up nearly 26% on year from 4.4 million hectares in the corresponding period last year, according to a report by the state agriculture department.

items.title: HG Infra Engineering: Why should you bet on this construction player?
items.description: The company has already carved a niche in the road construction space. Its diversification into newer segments is also yielding results and it boasts of a huge order book in the infrastructure segment

items.title: Ramky Infra stock gains 2.87% on Rs 215 crore contract from HMWSSB
items.description: The Company has been awarded a contract entailing the management and maintenance of sewage treatment plants and related infrastructure for a period of five years.

items.title: PNC Infra gets relief from High Court in disqualification order by MoRTH, NHAI
items.description: PNC Infratech and its two SPVs were disqualified by MoRTH and NHAI from participating in tendering process for a year in October. The decision was challenged by the company before the Division Bench of Delhi High Court in November through a Letters Patent Appeals.

items.title: Newgen Soft extends December rally to 44% after bagging $2.27 million Saudi Arabia order
items.description: Newgen Software is looking to expand its presence in the middle east with acquisition of new clients as well as upselling to existing customers. Shares of the company are higher by 44% in December so far, making it the top gainer among NSE 500.

items.title: Ceigall India shares rise 7% on new Rs 981-crore project from NHAI
items.description: Ceigall India specializes in infrastructure construction, undertaking projects like elevated roads, flyovers, bridges, tunnels, highways, expressways, and runways.

items.title: Godfrey Phillips India shares snap seven-day fall to rise 7%; board appoints new COO and updates on 24Seven trademark tussle
items.description: 24Seven Retail and Samir Modi, son of Managing Director Bina Modi, have sought royalty for trademark and moved a case before Delhi High Court. Godfrey Phillips India has contested the demands and said there is no royalty payable.

items.title: EPACK Durable stock prices gain 5% upon potential investment by Chinese TV manufacturer
items.description: The Company is involved in preliminary discussions with a Chinese television manufacturer to invest in EPACK Durable's wholly owned subsidiary

items.title: Importers take Tanzania, Thailand route to bring gold disguised as platinum alloy
items.description: According to multiple sources familiar with the development, importers are using a legally available route by importing alloy that has a platinum content of more than two percent – the rest is predominantly gold – and be in complete compliance with the Customs Tariff Act.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex trade flat amid volatility; metal, realty stocks drag; VIX rises 6%
items.description: The broader market underperformed the frontline indices with losses of 0.4 percent each. A host of market experts say that action in the broader market is largely stock-specific and investors should exercise caution and choose stocks that have earnings visibility and attractive valuations.

items.title: Live: No respite! Nifty ends third straight series on a somber note | Closing Bell
items.description: Sensex, Nifty rangebound in a thin trade. Quiet trade amid lack of FII participation. Nifty ends December series with 0.6% cuts. Third straight series of declines for Nifty. Auto, pharma extend gains to 2nd day. Metals, banks contribute to losses. India VIX jumps 6%, above 14 level. Join Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: ACME Solar Holdings shares end higher on Rs 1,988-crore PFC financing for hybrid projects
items.description: Separately, the company has won a 300 MW solar project under the SECI-ISTS XVIII scheme at a tariff of Rs 3.05 per unit.

items.title: Taking Stock: Sensex flat, Nifty at 23,750 amid expiry; media, FMCG drag, auto, pharma rally
items.description: BSE midcap and smallcap indices ended flat. On the sectoral front, buying was seen in the auto, energy, pharma, realty, PSU Bank, while selling was seen in the metal, FMCG, media.

items.title: Gujarat Fluorochem to sell captive power plant to arm IGREL Mahidad, invest in two subsidiaries
items.description: A power purchase agreement was also signed between Gujarat Fluorochem and IGREL Mahidad as well as Flurry Wind Energy at the rate of Rs 4 per unit, based on the number of units generated.

items.title: RBL Bank divested entire holding in DAM Capital during recently concluded IPO
items.description: DAM Capital's recently concluded IPO saw RBL Bank exit its shareholding entirely, representing 8.16% of the share capital. The bank added that it does not have any shareholding in DAM after the transaction.

items.title: Tata Group chairman Chandrasekaran's year-end note promises jobs push, sees AI acceleration ahead
items.description: Tata Group's N Chandrasekaran underscored in his year-end note that the Indian economy is strong and one can look ahead at 2025 with a sense of hope and optimism.

items.title: Bulk deals: Abakkus Asset Manager picks up 1.18% stake in Aarti Pharmalabs
items.description: Peak XV Partners Investment Holdings III also sold 12.02 lakh shares of One Mobikwik Systems Ltd.
